## Marp Presentation Creation for Technical Papers

### Core Marp Setup
- **Installation**: VS Code Extension "Marp for VS Code" (recommended for development)
- **CLI Alternative**: `npm install -g @marp-team/marp-cli` or `npx @marp-team/marp-cli@latest`
- **File Structure**: Create `.md` files with `marp: true` in front-matter

### Essential Syntax for Technical Papers
```markdown
---
marp: true
title: Paper Title
theme: default  # or gaia, uncover
paginate: true
backgroundColor: #fff
author: Researcher Name
---

# Paper Title
## Subtitle/Conference/Date

---

## Agenda
1. Introduction & Motivation
2. Technical Approach
3. Experimental Results
4. Conclusions & Future Work
```

### Advanced Layout Techniques for Technical Content

#### Split Layouts for Diagrams + Explanations
```markdown
![bg left:40%](architecture-diagram.jpg)
# Technical Architecture
- Component A: Handles X
- Component B: Processes Y
- Integration: Z mechanism
```

#### Multi-Column for Comparisons
```css
section {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
  gap: 2rem;
}
```

#### Math Formula Support
```markdown
$$
f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \hat{f}(\xi) e^{2 \pi i \xi x} d\xi
$$
```

### Export Options for Academic Use
- **PDF**: `marp --pdf slide-deck.md` (best for sharing)
- **HTML**: `marp slide-deck.md` (interactive, presenter mode)
- **PPTX**: `marp --pptx slide-deck.md` (PowerPoint compatibility)

### Technical Paper Slide Structure Best Practices
1. **Title Slide**: Paper title, authors, venue, date
2. **Problem Statement**: Clear motivation and challenges
3. **Technical Contribution**: Architecture diagrams, algorithms
4. **Experimental Setup**: Dataset, baselines, metrics
5. **Results**: Tables, graphs, ablation studies
6. **Conclusions**: Key insights and future work

### Advanced Features for Research Presentations
- **Speaker Notes**: `<!-- This is a speaker note -->`
- **Fragmented Lists**: Bullet points appear incrementally
- **Background Images**: `![bg](research-setup.jpg)` for context
- **Code Highlighting**: Native syntax highlighting for algorithms
- **Custom Themes**: CSS customization for institutional branding

## Technical Paper Presentation Structure & Best Practices

### Academic Slide Deck Template Structure
1. **Title Slide**
   - Paper title with clear, readable typography
   - Author names and affiliations
   - Conference/venue and date
   - Institution logos (if appropriate)

2. **Outline/Agenda** (Optional for short talks)
   - Problem statement
   - Technical approach
   - Experimental validation
   - Key contributions

3. **Problem Statement & Motivation** (2-3 slides)
   - Current limitations in the field
   - Research gap identification
   - Why this problem matters
   - Clear problem formulation

4. **Related Work** (1-2 slides)
   - Key prior approaches
   - Limitations of existing methods
   - Positioning of current work

5. **Technical Approach** (3-5 slides)
   - High-level overview first
   - Architecture diagrams with clear component labels
   - Mathematical formulations (when necessary)
   - Algorithm pseudocode (if applicable)
   - Key innovations highlighted

6. **Experimental Setup** (1-2 slides)
   - Datasets used
   - Baseline comparisons
   - Evaluation metrics
   - Implementation details

7. **Results & Analysis** (3-4 slides)
   - Quantitative results tables
   - Ablation studies
   - Qualitative examples
   - Error analysis/failure cases

8. **Conclusions & Future Work** (1-2 slides)
   - Key contributions summarized
   - Impact and implications
   - Limitations acknowledged
   - Future research directions

9. **Thank You/Questions** (1 slide)
   - Contact information
   - Code/data availability
   - Acknowledgments

### Design Principles for Technical Content
- **Clarity over complexity**: One main idea per slide
- **Visual hierarchy**: Use font sizes and colors to guide attention
- **Consistent styling**: Unified color scheme and typography
- **High contrast**: Ensure readability in various lighting conditions
- **Minimal text**: Use bullet points, not paragraphs
- **Quality figures**: Vector graphics preferred, high DPI images
- **Animation sparingly**: Only for revealing complex information step-by-step

### Marp-Specific Technical Presentation Tips
- Use `gaia` theme for professional academic look
- Enable pagination for conference presentations
- Include speaker notes for complex technical details
- Export to PDF for final submission/sharing
- Use consistent image sizing throughout
- Leverage split layouts for architecture explanations
- Employ grid layouts for comparison tables

## Latest Marp Features & Advanced Capabilities (2024-2025)

### Latest Version Updates (Marp Core v4)
- **New Layout System**: Changed from `display: flex` to `display: block` for slide containers
- **Improved Centering**: Uses modern CSS layout without Flexbox restrictions
- **Floating Layout Support**: Better CSS layout features, including floating elements
- **Baseline 2024 Browser Support**: Leverages latest browser capabilities
- **View Transitions API**: New bespoke template with custom transition effects

### Advanced CSS Theming & Customization
```css
/* Custom theme structure */
/* @theme your-theme-name */

@import 'default';  /* Import base theme */

section {
  width: 1280px;
  height: 720px;
  font-size: 40px;
  padding: 40px;
  background: linear-gradient(45deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
}

/* Responsive typography */
section { font-size: clamp(16px, 2.5vw, 28px); }
h1 { font-size: clamp(24px, 4vw, 48px); }
h2 { font-size: clamp(20px, 3vw, 36px); }
```

### Custom Transitions & Animations
- **Declarative CSS Transitions**: Custom animation sets without JavaScript
- **View Transitions API**: Modern browser transition effects
- **Built-in Transitions**: 90% coverage for common needs
- **Custom Registration**: CSS-based custom transition registration

### Math Formula Support (Enhanced)
```markdown
<!-- Inline math -->
Render inline math such as $ax^2+bc+c$.

<!-- Block math -->
$$
I_{xx}=\int\int_Ry^2f(x,y)\cdot{}dydx
$$

$$
f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty \hat f(\xi)\,e^{2 \pi i \xi x} \,d\xi
$$
```

### Advanced Configuration Options
```yaml
# .marprc.yml configuration
theme: custom-theme
output: ./dist
pdf: true
html: true
allowLocalFiles: true
watch: true
server: true
```

```javascript
// marp.config.js
export default {
  inputDir: './slides',
  output: './public',
  theme: 'gaia',
  themeSet: './themes',
  math: 'katex',  // or 'mathjax'
  minifyCSS: true,
  allowLocalFiles: true
}
```

### VS Code Integration Features
- **Live Theme Reloading**: Automatic CSS updates during theme development
- **GitHub Copilot Integration**: AI-assisted presentation export
- **Custom Theme Registration**: Remote URLs and local file support
- **Real-time Preview**: Live preview with instant updates

### Advanced CLI Commands
```bash
# Watch mode with custom theme
marp -w --theme ./css/custom.scss presentation.md

# Preview with live reload
marp presentation.md --theme custom.css --preview

# Multiple format export
marp presentation.md --pdf --html --pptx

# Server mode for presentation
marp -s ./slides-directory

# Custom output with configuration
marp presentation.md -o output.html --config marp.config.js
```

### Fragmented Lists & Animation Control
```markdown
<!-- Appear one by one -->
* Item 1
* Item 2
* Item 3

<!-- Custom animation timing -->
<!-- _transition: fade -->
<!-- _animation: slide-in -->
```

### Advanced Directives Support
```markdown

marp: true
theme: custom
title: "Presentation Title"
author: "Author Name"
date: "2025-01-01"
paginate: true

    background: linear-gradient(45deg, #ff6b6b, #4ecdc4);

---
```

- **GitHub Actions Support**: Automated publishing workflows
- **Docker Support**: Containerized slide generation
- **Web Deployment**: Direct HTML hosting capabilities
- **Version Control**: Git-friendly Markdown sources
